node.title: Australia has a submarine-shaped hole in its defences, and few options to fill it
node.alt: There are now calls for Australia to build more Collins class submarines while we await a nuclear submarine fleet which has not yet been commissioned.
node.description: The navy faces a looming headache on how to replace its ageing submarine fleet, one that a hurt French ambassador warns could create a 20-year hole in Australia's defences.
node.content:
["In a blistering National Press Club address on Wednesday,\u00a0France's ambassador warned that Australia may have created a submarine capability gap of up to 20 years by cancelling the contentious $90 billion project with his nation.", "Much of what Jean-Pierre Thebault said during his hour-long critique of the federal government is rigorously contested, but what is clear is that the navy faces a looming headache on how to replace its ageing Collins Class submarine fleet.", "Acquiring nuclear submarines will take decades, and over the next year or so Defence is studying the numerous American and British options available, as well as the various regulatory and workforce hurdles involved.", "Defence will begin the first comprehensive upgrade, or \"Life of Type Extension\", on a Collins Class boat in 2026, meaning it can be kept in the water for another decade \u2014 until 2036, when it was scheduled to be replaced by the first French-designed Attack Class boat.", "Similarly, a second submarine will have its life extended\u00a0in 2028, with the subsequent decommissioning to occur roughly a decade later, and so on, until all six Collins Class boats are eventually replaced before 2050.", "As recently as last month the Defence Force flagged that some Collins Class submarines could be kept in the water for another 30 years, with a yet unplanned second round of life extensions\u00a0that would see some boats operating half a century after they first came into service.", "Under the AUKUS announcement, the first nuclear-powered Australian submarine is not expected to be operational until around 2040, meaning at the very least this country's submarine fleet could be left short by one or two boats for several years.", "The scrapped French design was considered the best conventionally powered option, so now there are few options for the government if it wants to replace the operational capability provided by the ageing Collins Class submarines before nuclear-powered boats arrive.", "
Build, buy or borrow? None of the options are easy
", "Soon after the AUKUS bombshell was dropped in September, government ministers floated the prospect of Australia leasing submarines, but most military experts don't believe this option is viable.", "Very few nations have ever leased a submarine, and Australia's AUKUS partners \u2014\u00a0the United States and United Kingdom \u2014\u00a0don't appear to have any \"spare\" nuclear-powered boats lying around.\u00a0", "A similar option being discussed would be the forward deployment of one or two Virginia Class American submarines in Western Australia, or even the permanent basing of the US boats in Fremantle.\u00a0", "", "
Australia might not be able to acquire a \"spare\" nuclear submarine, but the US could permanently base some of theirs off Australia's coast.(AP:\u00a0Jack Sauer)
", "Last week, the Chief of Navy, Vice Admiral Mike Noonan, welcomed the \"first of many visits\" by\u00a0a British nuclear-powered Astute Class submarine to HMAS Stirling, giving a glimpse of how busy and important the West Australian base could be in coming years.", "While having American or British submarines operating out of Australia is a strong possibility, there is a far more remote option being suggested by industry of trying to build two or three more Collins Class submarines before Australia's nuclear boats arrive.", "", "
The \"first of many visits\" by a British nuclear submarine could signal a more permanent arrangement for a US and UK presence in Australian waters.(ABC News: Nicolas Perpitch)
", "Much of the infrastructure used to construct the Collins boats during the 1980s remains at the shipyards in Adelaide for submarine maintenance, although it would require several years of rapid action to get the yard ready to again build submarines.\u00a0", "Alternatively, SAAB-Kockums, the Swedish company which built the Collins Class, could be commissioned to produce a new submarine, but that would result in the undesirable outcome of Australia at some point having three different boats in its fleet.", "
The\u00a0solution may lie in outer space
", "Submarines are expensive, but the capabilities they provide \u2014 including surveillance, reconnaissance, and the delivery of special forces to high-risk locations \u2014 are invaluable to Australia's defence, and very difficult to replicate or replace.", "Last week, however, the Chief of Defence gave a broad hint of another possible alternative to bridge some submarine capabilities, which the Australian military may already be actively exploring.\u00a0", "\"It's a matter of combining, layering and creating systems of capability that, as you're indicating, do span air, sea surface, land, cyber and systems that can operate to enable and connect in space,\" General Angus Campbell told Senate estimates.", "\"We've got to think of defence capability as a system of systems across multiple domains, and, indeed, there are very advanced technologies in all of those domains that are of benefit to the defence of Australia\".", "The late senator John Madigan once famously described submarines as the \"spaceships of the ocean\", but perhaps space could soon prove to be the new frontier for undersea warfare."]
